basics.name: Ben Lieberman
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Ben is a self-taught programmer/full-stack developer, Marine Corps veteran, and published novelist. He has a wide range of skills and experience that make him a dynamic addition to any team.

work.name: New Mexico Administrative Office of District Attorneys
work.description: Providing IT support to the thirteen District Attorneys' offices in New Mexico
work.summary: The AODA maintains New Mexico's Case Management System (CMS), proprietary software for use by the District Attorneys' offices in managing case loads.
highlights: Performed critical API integration between AODA and the Administrative Office of the Courts using a simple Azure Function App and Queue.
Resolved long-standing open issues in current CMS.
Debugged and optimized SQL Server queries and stored procedures that are the backbone of CMS and a frequent source of errors.

work.name: Cortex Analytics
highlights: Prototyped and directed development of backend infrastructure for a mobile application for caregiver engagement
Ported a risk adjustment algorithm written in SAS to Python
Contributed features to complex data analysis web application using Angular and RxJS

publications.name: Filthy Synecdoche
publications.summary: A novel adapted from my experiences in and impressions of the Marine Corps.

projects.name: clj-baseball
projects.description: A port of the pybaseball project to Clojure
highlights: Emphasizes the functional and data driven approach of Clojure in preference to the Pandas API of pybaseball
